noun.description: A set of things working together as parts of a mechanism or an interconnecting network.
examples: fluid is pushed through a system of pipes or channels

noun.description: A set of principles or procedures according to which something is done; an organized scheme or method.
The prevailing political or social order, especially when regarded as oppressive and intransigent.
A set of staves in a musical score joined by a brace.

phrases: she let her get the crying out of her system
I think, at 16, it is good to get it out of your system.
I seem in the mood to read overlong pretentious epics - I really should go for a rummage in an airport bookshop or something and get it out of my system.
The bottom line is that your classmates don't care how you get it out of your system, just as long as you do it when they're not forced to listen to you.
We make it very easy for them to get it out of their system.
origin: Early 17th century: from French système or late Latin systema, from Greek sustēma, from sun- with + histanai set up.
